alert.note: Alert for Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 5:14PM MDT until August 03 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Pueblo County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 815 PM MDT. * At 514 PM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Pueblo West. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 30 minutes. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Northern Pueblo, Pueblo West and Pueblo Reservoir. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 30 MINUTES
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
